intro.speaker: Tirado
intro.line: What a pleasant surprise. It’s Master Valter.

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: What’s the situation, Tirado? You have captured Ephraim, haven’t you?

intro.speaker: Tirado
intro.line: No. Prince Ephraim still fights in the lands north of Renvall.

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: And why is that? What has happened to all those mercenaries you hired?

intro.speaker: Tirado
intro.line: They’ve proven to be less then adequate. Ephraim’s clever. His band strikes quickly and then vanishes into the woods. We more than double his numbers, and yet he uses the terrain wisely to fight us. He has no army–just a small force of knights loyal to Renais. Prince Ephraim’s reputation as a superb strategist would seem to be well earned.

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Hmm... How interesting. The lad’s beginning to whet my appetite. Tirado...Bring him to me as quickly as you can, will you?

intro.speaker: Tirado
intro.line: As you command. Just grant me an army, and I’ll bring him down swiftly.

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: What sort of plan do you have?

intro.speaker: Tirado
intro.line: Master, I am your loyal adjutant, and you are my general. For you, my lord, I have many plans ready and waiting.

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: Really? Well then, let me hear them.

intro.speaker: Tirado
intro.line: Very well. First, you and I will leave this fort and head north. Then, we will find Prince Ephraim in his leafy playpen.

intro.speaker: Valter
intro.line: But he’s not easily found, is he?

intro.speaker: Tirado
intro.line: Do not worry. At Prince Ephraim’s side is... a friend, shall we say. When the time is right, our friend will move on our behalf...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Forde, how are we on supplies and equipment?

intro.speaker: Forde
intro.line: It’s not looking good. Our weapons are in bad shape, and we’re running low on food. We can probably restock at a nearby village, but–

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: No, that’s not an option. We’re in enemy territory. I will not involve innocents if I can avoid it.

intro.speaker: Forde
intro.line: Yeah, I knew you’d say that. I mean, it’s because of stuff like that that we’ve stuck with you so far. But eventually, we do need to face reality. What are we going to do?

intro.speaker: Kyle
intro.line: Word of mouth has it that the invasion of Renais has progressed quite far. I’ve heard that the capital has fallen.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Hm...So soon... Still, my father is in the capital, and he won’t surrender easily. Forde, Kyle. Our mission here is to harry the troops, to distract their eye. Hopefully, we’ll be able to give my father and Eirika time to escape. Kyle, have you heard anything from Orson? I sent him ahead to scout.

intro.speaker: Kyle
intro.line: No word yet, and it’s about time he returned...

intro.speaker: Orson
intro.line: Reporting in, Prince Ephraim. I can confirm Grado presence at several points around our camp. Also, a large battalion of soldiers has been dispatched from Renvall. We shouldn’t tarry here any longer than necessary...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: I see.

intro.speaker: Forde
intro.line: Seems as though we’ve certainly caught Grado’s eye this time. Should we retreat back to the capital, Prince Ephraim?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: No. We press onward. We’re going to capture Renvall.

intro.speaker: Forde
intro.line: Wh-what?!?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: So this is Renvall, is it? All right, let’s go.

intro.speaker: Forde
intro.line: Um...Are you...sure you’re quite sane, Prince Ephraim? We’ve an entire army after us, and you want to charge their stronghold?

intro.speaker: Kyle
intro.line: Forde! Watch your tongue! This is our prince you’re addressing!

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Kyle, please, it’s all right. We’ve heard nothing from home, So what harm could a little reckless besieging cause?

intro.speaker: Kyle
intro.line: Prince Ephraim...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Don’t worry. I haven’t lost all sense of self-preservation. Renvall holds an important place in Grado’s national defense. If we can get the upper hand and take control of it, then Grado will waste many valuable soldiers trying to take it back I hope our attack proves useful to my father and Eirika.

intro.speaker: Forde
intro.line: I understand what you’re saying, but... can we do it with our current strength?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Every soldier in this area is trying to find us. The enemy has us vastly outnumbered. Attacking the castle is a ridiculous idea. If the enemy thinks the same... then we may have our opening.

intro.speaker: Forde
intro.line: You have a point. I’m sure Renvall won’t expect us to attack with these numbers. Either way, we can’t run forever. And we’re running out of supplies. What’ve we got to lose? Shall we get ready to go?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Yes. If we don’t move quickly, we may never get another chance. Trust me. I don’t pick fights I cannot win.

intro.speaker: Kyle
intro.line: Yes, sir!

intro.speaker: Zonta
intro.line: An attack? By Ephraim’s troops? To arms! Prince Ephraim’s circled around and brought the fight to us! If we capture the prince here, we can line our pockets with gold! Do you understand? We’ll be rich!

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Orson.

intro.speaker: Orson
intro.line: Yes...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Your wounds still haven’t healed from that last battle, have they? Don’t push yourself. If we’re defeated, you must return to Frelia. Understood?

intro.speaker: Orson
intro.line: Understood...

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Let’s go! Kyle! Forde!

boss.speaker: Zonta
boss.line: Do you truly think you can take us with those numbers? Imbecile! You’ll learn the error of your ways.

boss.speaker: Zonta
boss.line: L-lord Tirado...It can’t be... Were we...merely pawns?

end.speaker: Kyle
end.line: We’ve secured the entire castle. You were brilliant, Prince Ephraim! What a plan! What a battle!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I estimate at least half of the enemy troops are in the field. We took the castle, but we don’t have the manpower to hold it in a siege. There’s no point in lingering here. Let’s continue on to Grado Keep.

end.speaker: Forde
end.line: Prince Ephraim, things have taken a turn for the worse. I took a look around the castle perimeter... We’re surrounded.

end.speaker: Kyle
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Grado’s sent reinforcements? So quickly...?

end.speaker: Kyle
end.line: What should we do?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: ...... We must escape!

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: So, you’ve captured Renvall, have you? And with such a small force! Impressive! You’ve earned your reputation. I must say, I quite admire your work. I take it you’re the leader of this pack–the misguided Prince Ephraim.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I am.

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: I’m General Valter, the Moonstone of Grado’s Imperial Army. Catching up to you has caused me no small amount of trouble. We’ve reduced your wretched home of Renais to ruin, and yet... you and your little band of bravos continue to be a thorn in our side. But that all ends here.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: We’ll see...You claim you’ve taken the capital of Renais... Tell me, how did you know I would attack Renvall?

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Ha ha... Patience. You’ll have your answer soon enough. Now, be good lads, and drop your weapons, will you?

end.speaker: Kyle
end.line: Prince Ephraim, let us attack!

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Listen to me, Ephraim. You’re a smart man. You know it’s futile to fight me. You cannot win. You cannot escape. Accept the reality of your situation, and surrender to me.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Surrender?

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Heh heh heh... That’s right. If you do, I’ll let you live. I hold your life in the palm of my hand. Do not test my good humor. Now, come over here, bend your knee, and beg for your life. Show me how Renais dogs grovel.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: I think not.

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: What?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: You said your name was Valter, didn’t you? Well, I’m sorry, Valter, but I don’t have time to waste playing games with you. So, we’re going to knock you louts about a bit and then make our way out of here.

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: Fool... Have you gone mad? Do you truly believe you can fight your way past my wyvern knights?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Watch and see. I don’t pick fights I can’t win. Kyle, Forde. Are you ready?

end.speaker: Kyle
end.line: My life has been yours since the moment I took my chivalric vows.

end.speaker: Forde
end.line: It’s moments like these that keep me by your side, my prince.

end.speaker: Valter
end.line: What idiotic wretches you are... Prepare yourselves to be destroyed utterly!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: We break to the east. GO!
